Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, at first it wont be much, but if we get significant deposits, it could be important to be properly supported

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So I remeber that you need to move the funds at least once a month in order to be able to claim rewards.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after one month, the rewards stop increasing for a specific utxo

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: YEs

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: That I meant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so not claiming monthly, loses rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you can claim more often, just not so often to have txfees dominate

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Right

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think it is complex enough, the withdraw process. maybe the rewards claiming is done totally separately

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So we need to watch about two things. One is to be able to claim rewards (so I have to check that locktime thing) and the other that utxos are not over 30 days old

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, if a claim is being done, the withdraw cant be done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for withdraws, you want to make sure the utxo is less than an hour old. that way you lose no rewards

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: "if a claim is being done, the withdraw cant be done", you mean at that moment or after?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: utxo used for a claim, cant also be in a withdraw

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, after the claim is done, it can be used for withdraw

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so maybe there is a mutually exclusive mode for the msig signers, periods where they are doing claims and separately doing withdraws

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is a non-consensus thing, but still important part of the system

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, we can set some short period when they are claiming rewards and in that period withdraws won't work. But if I understand correct that period can be short. Just tx to claim rewards and move utxo to new one?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I'm not too much familiar with reward system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it can just be something done once per hour to check to see if any rewards should be claimed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no actual rewards system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just blockchain rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you spend a utxo that is over an hour old and more than 10 KMD and has locktime set, then you can spend more than the utxo value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the value increases at 5% rate, but stops growing after a month

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: THAT is the entire "system"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people then are motivated to spend monthly or more frequently to collect the rewards, but it is fully up to each address owner

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: BTW, I saw that default for createrawtransaction is locktime set to 0. So this means that txs created with that RPC by default can't get rewards, so you must set locktime?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if locktime isnt sent, it wont be eligible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: set it to 6 minutes in the past, should work well

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can sum the amount of interest you can claim, from the listunspent output

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So some dapps that are using createrawtransaction and not setting locktime cannot take rewards. I mean there are probably someone that doesn't know they can use this.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just increase the total you are spending by the sum of interest fields

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are using createrawtransaction, it is assumed you know what you are doing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we cant be claiming rewards hourly as that resets the counter, and there is not interest for the first hour

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe it should be that if doing a withdraw requires using utxo with significant amounts of rewards accrued, the msig signers would do a rewards claim first

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: And what locktime is default for sendtoaddress?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think 777 seconds in the past

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the check for accrued interest becomes part of the withdraw process

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and after 3 weeks, can have some background claiming process

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: BTW, claiming reward can also be part of withdraw? You spend the utxo by giving the amount to user and adding the interest to vins and having change back to deposit address?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it could, but then it would need to have locktime set

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the event it doesnt get broadcast within an hour, it will expire

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess that is not a very common occurance, so if you take into account failed withdraws due to expiration (ie. even if properly signed, if it takes too long, it wont be valid) then we can indeed combine the withdraw with claiming

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: And if we need to have locktime set it needs to be at least 1 hour?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what do you mean "at least 1 hour"

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: On how much locktime needs to be set?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: locktime must be > mediantimepast, which is about 10 minutes ago

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it cant be in the future

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so there is a 10 minutes of valid values

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm, than I'm confused what locktime represents

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but, there is an additional check in KMD that prevents locktime more than an hour old

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just imagine locktime to mean "now", approximately

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: cant set it too far back in time, and cant set it in the future

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I thought locktime indicates the earliest time or earliest block when that transaction may be added to the block chain.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the specific check is against the median time past, so the time of 9 blocks ago

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD had to add a restriction of "no more than one hour old" to prevent back dating a tx to gain rewards

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, so if we set locktime to now we have approx. 9 blocks for tx to enter and then it expires?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you set it to now, it will be valid for an hour

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but depending on the miner that sets the blocktime, it might not be accepted (if it ends up being after the miners blocktime), so setting it to the recent past is the safest and still gives 50+ minutes to confirm

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I don't get the calc but never mind. So in order to KISS, we can expire a withdraw after an hour or so to make the invalid withdraws expire and also the valid ones if they didn't finished in hour it means someting is wrong. And this way we can also use claiming rewards as a part of withdraw. BTW, the chains that uses gateways (any variant) should need to have notarization as without it regardless of this limitation it will be bad UX to wait for 100 confs before it can sign it and broadcast it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct

Content: @gcharang channel topic updated!

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
The Pegs Antara modules is a mechanism for creating a decentralized stable coin, pegged to any asset like fiat currency, stock, crypto that has a reliable price source 
Intro + RPC: <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-api/pegs.html>
User tutorial: <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-tutorials/pegs-module-user-tutorial.html>
Peg Creator tutorial: <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-tutorials/pegs-module-creator-tutorial.html>

Testing and Feedback are welcome!

Content: @Mihailo plz review the docs for accuracy

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, np.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
@gcharang I have read the documents, here are my remarks.
Intro:
- "To prevent their deposit from being liquidated, the user can either return some of the USDK coins or deposit more tokenized KMD to maintain a good debt ratio."  -> user must either cover whole debt or deposit more KMD, there is no partial return
- In Pegs Anatar Module Flow, I would add a step where user deposits external crypto into tokens

User tutorial:
- Add the part between KMD deposit and gateway deposit: You must wait for the block where the KMD tx is mined to be submitted to oracle. This can be checkd using oraclessamples call to fetch for exmaple last 5 data entries and check if the height is more or equal to the heigth of the KMD block where the tx is.

Craetor tutorial:
- The synthetic price won't work as it is refering to KMD and the external chain used is KMDTEST. Basically everything must match: external coin name, name in synthetic, token name and oracle name!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
@jl777c One more thing regarding locktime. As users that are depositing use z_sendmany to send to deposit address, I think locktime isn't set there. So we must initially spend the utxo to set locktime and then it can stay for accumulating reward?
This is all ofc for KMD chain only, as others don't have rewards...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i had thought z_sendmany set locktime. can people use sendmany?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
Ha, you are correct. Locktime is set in z_sendmany. 
Yes, we have used z_sendmany as deposit tx in all tutorials from the start. I don't know why that was but I inherited it when I start working on gateways.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably because z_sendmany can specify a source address

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, I remebered now.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c I have one dilema. When you make the withdraw and it is broadcasted on external chain, than that utxo won't show in listunspent until tx is mined. Currently I have posted deposit address balance to oracle by using listunspent. On my test chain I had just one utxo so when withdraw is broadcasted I don't have any more utxo so the balance is 0. My question is, should I check the mempool also to see if there are some vouts that goes to deposit address? (it might catch also deposit tx and count those for balance too)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in non-consensus code, you can scan mempool for balance calcs

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: This is basically check in oraclefeed. And it will post it to oracle along with block data. And then in rpc and validation the balance will be checked from oracle to see if the withdraw tx can be created for given amount

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, yes, use the mempool info. you are doing a majority test, so it should match in most of the nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe make the oracle have confirmed and uncomfirmed balance?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way, a discrepancy in the mempool info can be somehow accounted for

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
We have new MBTCTEST chain for those who are testing. Please delete old komodo source dir, data dir. Clone fresh, compile as per the guide and start the KMD & MBTCTEST chain. You should be able to make multiple withdraws, but they will be processed serialized (one by one). The withdraw should complete fast as after withdraw tx is confrimed it will be signed and broadcasted immediatelly. So you can check on your KMD node with `getunconfirmedbalance` to see it before the block is mined!
Initial Guide: https://gist.github.com/himu007/5b61ebb330ee46c4c1f7518d34e30d42
Break the system if you can with your testing power.
